raw_comment:
-What do you notice?
In general, I realized that the points that are closer to the line indicate that among countries, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction especially Indonesia, India, Nigeria, Bangladesh, Morocco, and Mali. While some other countries like Japan and US have a huge difference between young and old generation inside the countries.

-What do you wonder?
Why most of the dots close to the line are mostly from Africa?
Why are young people more satisfied with their country？

-How does this relate to you and your community?
The more developed the country, the higher the level of satisfaction of the masses.

-What’s going on in this graph?
Has the world gotten better or worse?
ace_sentences: In general, I notice a line in the graph.
A point that is closer to the line indicates that the old and the young are closer in satisfaction in a country.
In Indonesia, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
In India, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
In Nigeria, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
In Bangladesh, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
In Morocco, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
In Mali, the old and the young are closer in satisfaction.
In Japan, there is a huge difference in satisfaction between the young and the old.
In the US, there is a huge difference in satisfaction between the young and the old.
I wonder why most dots that are close to the line are from Africa.
I wonder why young people are more satisfied with their country.
I think that a more developed country has a higher level of satisfaction of the masses.
I ask what is going on in this graph.
I ask whether the world has gotten better.
I ask whether the world has gotten worse.
